body:
As an admin, you can enable single sign-on (SSO) for your organization with Okta as Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) identity provider. Using Single sign-on with HackerRank allows companies of any size to leverage their existing corporate directories and authentication systems to authorize employee access to HackerRank for Work. It enables the users to log in with a single ID and password to access a connected system.

Prerequisites

  • You must have an Okta admin account for your organization.
  • You must have obtained the Single sign on URL and Audience URI (SP Entity ID) from the HackerRank Customer Support team.

Steps

  1. Log in to your Okta account with admin credentials and then click Applications on the home page.
  2. In the displayed page, click Create New App.
  3. In the Create a New Application Intergration dialog box, select the SAML 2.0 radio button and then click Create.

    Step Result: The Create SAML Integration page is displayed.
  4. In the General Settings tab, specify the App Name you want to add. Upload the app logo (optional), select the App visibility settings(optional), and then click Next.
  5. In the SAML Settings section of the Configure SAML tab, specify the Single sign on URL and Audience URI (SP Entity ID) that the HackerRank Customer Support team has provided and then Click Next.
    You are not required to modify any other default settings on this tab unless required by your own environment.
  6. In the Feedback tab, select the appropriate radio button specifying if you are a customer or partner and then click Finish.
  7. In the Sign on Methods section of the displayed page, click the Identity provider metadata link.
    The metadata file is downloaded. 

     Note: You must send one of these files to the HackerRank Customer Support team. Only, after our Customer Support team uploads this file to our system, the SSO is enabled for your organization.

    Expect a downtime of 2 hours for your SSO to work after you send this file to our Customer Support team.

  8. Click the Assignments tab. 
  9. Click Assign on the displayed page and then click Assign to Groups from the drop down menu.
  10. In the Assign HackerRank to Groups dialog box, click Assign to enable SSO for all users in your organization and then click Done.
    Alternatively, you can click Assign to People in Step 9 and specify particular users in your organization for whom you want to enable to SSO.

    Task result: You have completed all the steps to enable SSO for your organization. Once our Customer Support team uploads the metadata file, the SSO will be enabled for your organization.
title: SSO with Okta
